catalog.name: CIDA Development and Testing USGS Internal THREDDS Server.

dataset.name: CIDA THREDDS Holdings
dataset.documentation: Datasets held by the Center for Integrated Data Analytics for access via TDS.

dataset.name: Gridded Meteorological Observations by Ed Maurer
dataset.documentation: Freely Available.
Gridded Meteorological Observations

Maurer, E.P., A.W. Wood, J.C. Adam, D.P. Lettenmaier, and B. Nijssen, 2002, A Long-Term Hydrologically-Based Data Set of Land Surface Fluxes and States for the Conterminous United States, J. Climate 15(22), 3237-3251

dataset.name: National RFC QPE Mosaic

documentation.xlink:title: NWS Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service About Page

dataset.documentation: Freely Available.
National Mosaic of Radar indicated-rain gage verified and corrected precipitation estimate on a ~10km grid. 6 hour temporal resolution. Files are added daily from the latest 7 day dataset.

dataset.name: Real Time National RFC QPE Mosaic

documentation.xlink:title: NWS Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service About Page

dataset.documentation: Freely Available.

National Mosaic of Radar indicated-rain gage verified and corrected precipitation estimate on a !10km grid. 6 hour temporal resolution. Files are updated from the NPVU holdings hourly. The files may be updated for two to three days after originally becoming available as river forecasting centers provide and adjust their rainfall estimates.

dataset.name: North Central River Forecasting Center QPE

documentation.xlink:title: NWS Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service About Page

dataset.documentation: Freely Available.
Radar indicated-rain gage verified and corrected precipitation estimate on the ~4km HRAP grid. 1 hour and 6 hour temporal resolution. Includes only the North Central River Forecasting Center's data.

dataset.name: Real Time North Central River Forecasting Center QPE

documentation.xlink:title: NWS Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service About Page

dataset.documentation: Freely Available.

Latest available 7 days of radar indicated-rain gage verified and corrected precipitation estimate on the ~4km HRAP grid. 1 hour and 6 hour temporal resolution. Includes only the North Central River Forecasting Center's data.

dataset.name: Ohio River Forecasting Center QPE

documentation.xlink:title: NWS Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service About Page

dataset.documentation: Freely Available.
Radar indicated-rain gage verified and corrected precipitation estimate on the ~4km HRAP grid. 1 hour and 6 hour temporal resolution. Includes only the Ohio River Forecasting Center's data.

dataset.name: Real Time Ohio River Forecasting Center QPE

documentation.xlink:title: NWS Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service About Page

dataset.documentation: Freely Available.

Latest available 7 days of radar indicated-rain gage verified and corrected precipitation estimate on the ~4km HRAP grid. 1 hour and 6 hour temporal resolution. Includes only the Ohio River Forecasting Center's data.

documentation.xlink:title: NWS Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service About Page

dataset.documentation: Freely Available.
Radar indicated-rain gage verified and corrected precipitation estimate on the ~4km HRAP grid. 1 hour and 6 hour temporal resolution. Includes only the North East River Forecasting Center's data.

dataset.name: US GFDL A1 Monthly Tavg 1960-2099
dataset.documentation: Freely Available.
Downscaled monthly average temperature

Fri Mar 24 15:50:23 2006: ncrcat us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.1960-1969.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.1970-1979.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.1980-1989.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.1990-1999.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.2000-2009.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.2010-2019.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.2020-2029.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.2030-2039.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.2040-2049.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.2050-2059.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.2060-2069.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.2070-2079.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.2080-2089.nc us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.2090-2099.nc us_gfdl.A1.monthly.Tavg.1960-2099.nc Fri Mar 3 14:50:25 2006: ncrcat -O -p /data/emaurer/us_ipcc/sresa1fi/prep/fut.gfdl_cm2_1/vic_scale/ncfiles -n 10,4,1 us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.1960.nc /data/emaurer/us_ipcc/sresa1fi/prep/fut.gfdl_cm2_1/vic_scale/ncfiles/us_gfdl_cm2_1.sresa1fi.monthly.Tavg.1960-1969.nc Downscaled Data

dataset.name: US GFDL sresa2 Air Temp 2001-2100
dataset.documentation: Freely Available.
Air Temperature from GFDL CM2.1, SRESA2 (run1) SRES A2 experiment output for IPCC AR4 and US CCSP
input/atmos.200101-210012.t_ref.nc At 10:21:57 on 01/28/2005, CMOR rewrote data to comply with CF standards and IPCC Fourth Assessment and US CCSP Projects requirements

GFDL experiment name = CM2.1U-H2_SresA2_W1. PCMDI experiment name = SRESA2 (run1). Initial conditions for this experiment were taken from 1 January 2001 of the climate of the 20th century experiment named CM2.1U-D4_1860-2000-AllForc_H2. Several time varying forcing agents used during the first 100 years of this CM2.1U-H2_SresA2_W1 experiment were based on output of the MOZART global atmospheric chemistry climate model when driven with the SRES A2 emission scenarios. For the CM2.1U-H2_SresA2_W1 experiment volcanic aerosols were zero, land surface cover types were time invariant, and solar irradiance varied seasonally based upon late 20th century averages but with no interannual variation.

The GFDL Data Portal (http://nomads.gfdl.noaa.gov/) provides access to NOAA/GFDL's publicly available model input and output data sets. From this web site one can view and download data sets and documentation, including those related to the GFDL CM2.1 model experiments run for the IPCC's 4th Assessment Report and the US CCSP.

creator.name: IPCC Fourth Assessment and US CCSP Projects

dataset.name: US GFDL sresa2 Geopotential Height 2001-2100
dataset.documentation: Freely Available.
Geopotential Height from GFDL CM2.1, SRESA2 (run1) SRES A2 experiment output for IPCC AR4 and US CCSP
input/atmos.200101-210012.t_ref.nc At 10:21:57 on 01/28/2005, CMOR rewrote data to comply with CF standards and IPCC Fourth Assessment and US CCSP Projects requirements

GFDL experiment name = CM2.1U-H2_SresA2_W1. PCMDI experiment name = SRESA2 (run1). Initial conditions for this experiment were taken from 1 January 2001 of the climate of the 20th century experiment named CM2.1U-D4_1860-2000-AllForc_H2. Several time varying forcing agents used during the first 100 years of this CM2.1U-H2_SresA2_W1 experiment were based on output of the MOZART global atmospheric chemistry climate model when driven with the SRES A2 emission scenarios. For the CM2.1U-H2_SresA2_W1 experiment volcanic aerosols were zero, land surface cover types were time invariant, and solar irradiance varied seasonally based upon late 20th century averages but with no interannual variation.

The GFDL Data Portal (http://nomads.gfdl.noaa.gov/) provides access to NOAA/GFDL's publicly available model input and output data sets. From this web site one can view and download data sets and documentation, including those related to the GFDL CM2.1 model experiments run for the IPCC's 4th Assessment Report and the US CCSP.
